5namespace namu {
6 class _nout typeProvidable {
7 NAMU_DECL_ME(typeProvidable)
8
9 public:
10 nbool operator==(const me& rhs) const;
11 nbool operator!=(const me& rhs) const;
12
13 public:
14 virtual const type& getType() const = 0;
15 nbool isSub(const type& it) const;
16 nbool isSub(const typeProvidable& it) const {
17 return isSub(it.getType());
18 }
19 nbool isSuper(const type& it) const;
20 template <typename T> nbool isSub() const { return getType().isSub<T>(); }
21 template <typename T> nbool isSuper() const { return getType().isSuper<T>(); }
22
23 template <typename T>
24 T& cast() {
25 // this protection:
26 // this c namu interpreter uses references in default, and not any pointers.
27 // so you always care about a refer can be nulled.
28 // for a convenience of our API users I put this guard.
29 //
30 // please note that checking whether thisptr is null isn't recommended in
31 // ordinary cpp.
32#pragma clang diagnostic push
33#pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wtautological-undefined-compare"
34 if (this == nullptr)
35 return nulOf<T>();
36#pragma clang diagnostic pop
37
38 return *(T*) cast(ttype<T>::get());
39 }
40
41 template <typename T> const T& cast() const NAMU_UNCONST_FUNC(cast<T>())
42
43 virtual void* cast(const type& to);
44 const void* cast(const type& to) const NAMU_UNCONST_FUNC(cast(to))
45
46 protected:
47 virtual nbool _onSame(const me& rhs) const;
48 };
49}
